TMPS001.c File Reference

Die Temperature Sensor TMPS001 App. More...

Detailed Description

Die Temperature Sensor TMPS001 App.

Definition in file TMPS001.c.

#include <DAVE3.h>

Functions

status_t TMPS001_StartMeasurement (void)
 The Die Temperature Sensor (DTS) generates a measurement by calling TMPS001_StartMeasurement() result that indicates directly the current temperature.The result of the measurement can be obtained by calling TMPS001_ReadTemp().
status_t TMPS001_GetStatus (void)
 This function gets the status of the die temperature sensor.
uint32_t TMPS001_ReadTemp (void)
 This function calculates the temperature and returns the value in celsius. Note that the temperature returns only a integer value, as the resolution of DTS sensor is +/- 6 degree celsius.

Function Documentation

status_t TMPS001_GetStatus ( void  )

This function gets the status of the die temperature sensor.

Parameters:
[in]Null
Returns:
status_t
TMPS001_READY DTS is in ready state
TMPS001_BUSY Die Temperature Sensor Busy
TMPS001_FAIL DTS not powered on

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>

  int main(void)
  {
    uint32_t Temp =0;
    TMPS001_Enable();
    if(TMPS001_GetStatus() == TMPS001_READY)
    TMPS001_StartMeasurement();
    //.. delay
    Temp = TMPS001_ReadTemp();
    // ....
    return 0;
  }


<<<DD_TMPS001_API_3>>>

Definition at line 108 of file TMPS001.c.

uint32_t TMPS001_ReadTemp ( void  )

This function calculates the temperature and returns the value in celsius. Note that the temperature returns only a integer value, as the resolution of DTS sensor is +/- 6 degree celsius.

Parameters:
[in]Pointercontain measured value returned by function
Returns:
uint32_t(Measured temperature in Celcius)

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>

  int main(void)
  {
    uint32_t Temp =0;
    TMPS001_Enable();
    if(TMPS001_GetStatus() == TMPS001_READY)
    TMPS001_StartMeasurement();
    //.. delay
    Temp = TMPS001_ReadTemp();
    // ....
    return 0;
  }

The Die Temperature Sensor (DTS) generates a measurement by calling TMPS001_StartMeasurement() result that indicates directly the current temperature.The result of the measurement can be obtained by calling TMPS001_ReadTemp().
